alert.note: Alert for Elbert (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 13 at 2:37AM MDT until June 13 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch could occur this afternoon. * WHERE...The Bijou Creek Basin in east central and northeast Colorado, including the following counties, in east central Colorado, Elbert. In northeast Colorado, Adams, Arapahoe and Morgan. * WHEN...Until 400 PM MDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 234 AM MDT, Water was reported flowing into Morgan Co. Emergency management reported flooding along East Bijou Creek west of Agate in the warned area. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen yesterday in the upper part of the basin. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch could occur this afternoon. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Bijou Creek basin including East Bijou, Middle Bijou and West Bijou Creeks and their tributaries. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Deer Trail, Byers, Agate, Leader, Hoyt and Hoyt Beet Dump.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
